result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
original filed in 15CF476 
-of Plea Hearing held on May 25, 2016 
-of Sentencing Hearing held on August 11, 2016
Sentencing hearing on August 11, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Christopher A Philipp in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CF-476, 15CM-367, 15CF-471 and 15CF-475.

11:45 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Constable states appearances.

Address for Defendant is verified.

State provided the Court with the offer in the form of a chart, because there are so many charges in the cases.

15CF-476:
Defendant will plead to Count 1, 2, 3, 5, and 6.
Counts 4, 7, 8, 9, 10, 11, 12, 13, 14 and 15 are dismissed and readin
15CF-475, 15CF-471 and 15CM-376 are dismissed and read in

State also submitted an uncharged read in, 15PT-1817.

State requests a PSI. State agrees to cap confinement at 7 years. There will also be restitution sought.

State has complied with victim notification statues.
There are no victims present in this case.

Atty Schmidt concurs.
Defendant concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
GUILTY to  Counts 1, 2, 3, 5 and 6 in 15CF-476.

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Schmidt for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CF-476: Count 1 Burglary, as a party to the crime
15CF-476: Count 2 Burglary, as a party to the crime
15CF-476: Count 3 Burglary, as a party to the crime
15CF-476: Count 5 Burglary, as a party to the crime
15CF-476: Count 6 Burglary, as a party to the crime
15CF-476: Counts 4, 7, 8, 9, 10, 11, 12, 13, 14 and 15 are dismissed and read in
15CF-475: Dismissed and read in
15CF-471: Dismissed and read in
15CM-367: Dismissed and read in

Parties are recommending a PSI.

BY THE COURT:
Court will order a PSI.
Report be completed at least one week prior to sentencing and provided to the parties.

Court is inclined to revoke bond.
Atty Schmidt addresses the Court regarding bond. 

Court questions Defendant as to employment.
Atty Schmidt replies as to assurance of appearing and not committing any more crimes.

BY THE COURT:
Court will not revoke bond. Court will need to get permission to hear this on August 11th from Branch 3. 
Bond is continued.
Plea hearing on May 25, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Prior: 8722 County F, Arpin, WI 54410 United States

Pre-trial conference on April 18, 2016 at 08:45 am.

records.addlTxt: No contact with Cintas Gas Station and Maher Water during the pendency of this matter.

Defendant Christopher A Philipp in court, in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:23 p.m. case is called.  
Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Court advises defendant of right to counsel and can contact Public Defender's office for representation.
NG plea is entered on his behalf.

ADA requests why the defendant failed to appear.
Court questions the defendant.  
Defendant was advised by his attorney (Eric Sheets) that he did not need to be present. 
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 09:15 am.

Defendant Christopher A Philipp not in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:14 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

BY THE COURT:  Court finds complaint shows probable cause.  Criminal warrant.
